org.openimaj.vis.general

Class ImageThumbnailPlotter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.vis.general.ImageThumbnailPlotter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ItemPlotter<MBFImage,Float[],MBFImage>

    public class ImageThumbnailPlotter
extends Object
implements ItemPlotter<MBFImage,Float[],MBFImage>
    An item plotter that is able to plot images into a visualisation at a given position and size. The thumbnail size is initially 100 pixels, but if you need to alter this based on the size of the visualisation, you can use the setThumbnailSize(int) method to set the maximum dimension.
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

        public void plotObject(MBFImage visImage,

              AxesRenderer2D<Float[],MBFImage> renderer)
        Description copied from interface: ItemPlotter
        Plots a specific object to the visualisation using the AxesRenderer2D to provide the position of the object. Should side affect the given image.

        Parameters:

      • renderRestarting

        public void renderRestarting()
        Called just before a render of the visualisation is about to start. This can be used to prepare context objects for the plotObject method.
        Specified by:
